Literature Review: Engineering themes in plant forms and functions refer to the intricate structures and mechanisms that enable plants to interact with their environment. These structures, often overlooked as mere biological entities, exhibit remarkable engineering principles that have evolved over time. This review aims to explore the signatures of engineering mechanisms in plant biology, focusing on three thematic motifs: bilayer actuator, slender-bodied functional surface, and self-similarity. We will examine the structureâ€“function relationships of these motifs and discuss the factors that may influence the evolution of functional morphology and anatomy in plants.
